intro: Pseudolysimachion galactites, commonly known as the milkweed vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, with a distinctive corolla shape. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, containing cardiac glycosides. Pseudolysimachion galactites is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
